definition: Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

pinyin: Sa4 da2 mu3 · Hou2 sai4 yin1

sentences.english: Yusra Hussain is a clinical instructor a geriatrician.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因医生是一名临床带教教员和老年医学专家。

sentences.english: Hussein was in the United States for cancer treatments at the Mayo Clinic.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因来美国是去梅奥医学中心治疗癌症。

sentences.english: We learned that Sadat was now pressing King Hussein to join the battle.
sentences.chinese: 我们得悉萨达特这时正在力促侯赛因国王参战。

sentences.english: Hussain won the toss and chose to field first.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因猜掷币赢了，选定先任守队。

sentences.english: Truly, Al-Hussein was injured while he was striving in Allah's Cause.
sentences.chinese: 的确，侯赛因是在为主道奋斗时受伤害的。

sentences.english: Muhammad despised Saddam Hussein's despotic regime.
sentences.chinese: 默罕默德瞧不起萨达姆侯赛因的暴虐政权。

sentences.english: Hussein and his unreconciled supporters among Iraq's Sunni minority, there was an explosion of anger.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因先生及其逊尼派中不甘心的支持者们怒气爆发。

sentences.english: Barack Hussein Obama would present another challenge for Iran's mullahs .
sentences.chinese: 巴拉克侯赛因奥巴马，伊朗毛拉们的又一威胁。

sentences.english: The King designated Hussein as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 国王选定侯赛因为他的接班人。

sentences.english: Allegedly April Fool is the codename of a spy that played a pivotal role in bringing down Saddam Hussein.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因的行动中起关键作用的间谍的代号。

sentences.english: Hussein called his assistants and they brought along donkeys.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因召来助手牵来了驴子。

sentences.english: Hussein thought that if this could be done, we should try.
sentences.chinese: 侯赛因认为如果有成功的可能，不妨一试。
然而，31岁侯赛因是一位穆斯林。

sentences.english: On the twentieth, King Hussein and Queen Noor joined us.
sentences.chinese: 20日，约旦国王侯赛因和王后努尔来访。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
(loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
